intro: Raimannia odorata, commonly known as the sweetgrass or fragrant grass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in grassland and woodland habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves that emit a pleasant fragrance when crushed. Raimannia odorata typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils due to its aromatic properties.
